story.iWant: to set up the foundational React project using Vite with TypeScript
story.soThat: I have a clean, performant, and well-configured environment for building the Single-Page Application.
story.tasks: - [ ] Set up a new React project using `npm create vite@latest portfolio-react -- --template react-ts` (AC: 1, 2, 3) - [ ] Configure ESLint for TypeScript and React (AC: 4) - [ ] Configure Prettier for code formatting (AC: 4) - [ ] Integrate basic performance monitoring tools/configurations (e.g., Lighthouse CI, Web Vitals reporting) (AC: 4)

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. **Given** a new project is created 2. **When** I run the development server 3. **Then** I see a blank React application running without errors. 4. **And** the project includes basic linting, formatting, and performance monitoring (e.g., Lighthouse, Web Vitals) configurations.

doc.snippet: FR1: The application must be migrated from static HTML/CSS/JS to a React-based Single-Page Application (SPA).
